title: Spotify
deleted: Spotify offers advertisers ten different types of advertising formats, described in 2016 as: Branded Moments, Sponsored Playlists, Sponsored Sessions, Video Takeovers, Audio, Display, Overlay, Homepage Takeovers, Branded Playlists, and Advertiser Pages. These advertisements vary in size, type and user engagement.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://spotifyforbrands.com/us/formats/|title=Formats|publisher=Spotify|accessdate=16 December 2016|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161219072547/https://spotifyforbrands.com/us/formats/|archivedate=19 December 2016}}</ref>

* Branded Moments allow brands to "tell their story over a series of sequential displays with 100% share-of-voice during the 30-minute session" by using "an immersive vertical video" and can unlock 30 minutes of uninterrupted music.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://spotifyforbrands.com/us/format/branded-moments/|title=Branded Moments|publisher=Spotify|access-date=16 December 2016|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161220134032/https://spotifyforbrands.com/us/format/branded-moments/|archivedate=20 December 2016}}</ref>

* Sponsored Playlist is an "exclusive one week sponsorship of Spotifyâ€™s top owned & operated playlists".<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://spotifyforbrands.com/us/format/sponsored-playlist/|title=Sponsored Playlist|publisher=Spotify|access-date=16 December 2016|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161220134035/https://spotifyforbrands.com/us/format/sponsored-playlist/|archivedate=20 December 2016}}</ref>

* Sponsored Sessions allow brands to "offer their audience uninterrupted listening in exchange for a video view". They are only available on mobile and tablet devices and are limited to select markets.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://spotifyforbrands.com/us/format/sponsored-session/|title=Sponsored Session|publisher=Spotify|access-date=16 December 2016|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161220134624/https://spotifyforbrands.com/us/format/sponsored-session/|archivedate=20 December 2016}}</ref>

* Video Takeover is a "video spot with a companion display unit", is "served during commercial ad breaks between songs in a music session", and is only available on the computer apps.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://spotifyforbrands.com/us/format/video-takeover/|title=Video Takeover|publisher=Spotify|access-date=16 December 2016|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161220134538/https://spotifyforbrands.com/us/format/video-takeover/|archivedate=20 December 2016}}</ref>

* Audio Ads are "served during commercial ad breaks between songs in a music session" with a maximum duration of 30 seconds and play every 15 minutes.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://spotifyforbrands.com/us/format/audio/|title=Audio|publisher=Spotify|accessdate=16 December 2016|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161220135642/https://spotifyforbrands.com/us/format/audio/|archivedate=20 December 2016}}</ref>

* Display Ads are "clickable images displayed for 30 seconds". Display ads are shown at the bottom of the Spotify client.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://spotifyforbrands.com/us/format/display/|title=Display|publisher=Spotify|accessdate=16 December 2016|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161220135233/https://spotifyforbrands.com/us/format/display/|archivedate=20 December 2016}}</ref>

* Overlay is "Spotify's 'welcome back' ad. It greets returning users on mobile and desktop with a can't-be-missed, large display ad to maximize brand impact and performance".<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://spotifyforbrands.com/us/format/overlay/|title=Overlay|publisher=Spotify|access-date=16 December 2016|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161220134714/https://spotifyforbrands.com/us/format/overlay/|archivedate=20 December 2016}}</ref>

* Homepage Takeovers are "a combination of background skin and optional interactive area that takes over the Spotify homepage".<ref>{{cite web|url=https://spotifyforbrands.com/us/format/homepage-takeover/|title=Homepage Takeover|publisher=Spotify|accessdate=16 December 2016|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161220133939/https://spotifyforbrands.com/us/format/homepage-takeover/|archivedate=20 December 2016}}</ref>

* Branded Playlists are "Spotify playlists that contain a branded cover art image and text". They can only have one song per artist, and must have a minimum of 20 tracks in the playlist.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://spotifyforbrands.com/us/format/branded-playlist/|title=Branded Playlists|publisher=Spotify|accessdate=16 December 2016|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161220135143/https://spotifyforbrands.com/us/format/branded-playlist/|archivedate=20 December 2016}}</ref>

* Advertiser Pages are a "microsite seamlessly integrated into the Spotify player", that can "contain practically any content you'd find on a webpage, including videos, clickable images, blogs, news, links, and comments."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://spotifyforbrands.com/us/format/advertiser-page/|title=Advertiser Page|publisher=Spotify|accessdate=16 December 2016|url-status=dead|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161220133853/https://spotifyforbrands.com/us/format/advertiser-page/|archivedate=20 December 2016}}</ref>

In January 2020, Spotify launched its own Streaming Ad Insertion technology (SAI) that inserts ads into podcasts as people listen. Ad choice adapts based on the user's profile and location data. These ads still play for Premium account subscribers and the company has announced plans to expand podcast ad units with interactive elements. <ref>{{Cite web|last=Carman|first=Ashley|date=2020-06-22|title=Spotify is testing interactive podcast ads so you never have to remember a promo code again|url=https://www.theverge.com/2020/6/22/21295859/spotify-interactive-ads-podcasts-in-app-offer-launch|access-date=2020-11-03|website=The Verge|language=en}}</ref>
